weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a blanket of thick, brooding clouds. The city, often kissed by fog, is currently shrouded in gray, with the vague outlines of buildings softened by the damp atmosphere. A whisper of drizzle is anticipated, with the weather taking a more definitive turn into steady rain this evening, as the skies promise to unleash their contents entirely. The air, heavier than usual, carries a chill that hints at winter’s embrace, with temperatures hovering around the low sixties, and as evening approaches, slight warmth may emerge, only to be enveloped by the rain’s return.

This is not the quintessential San Francisco day for open-air excursions. Instead, consider those cozy moments indoors. Perhaps a stroll through one of the local cafés where the aroma of brewing coffee mingles warmly with tales of festive gatherings. Layers will be your best friend; a well-worn sweater over a shirt, combined with a waterproof jacket, will offer comfort against the damp winds that might pick up, biting with a sharp chill. As the rain begins to fall, the cityscape morphs into a mirage of blurred lights reflecting on slick pavements, where the ethereal pulse of urban life continues undeterred. This evening, as the clouds rumble above, allow yourself to sink into the cozy corners of the city, perhaps with a good book or in the company of friends, savoring the quiet intensity of a winter’s night.
